# jira-cli-skill

Claude Code plugin that teaches Claude how to use the [jira CLI](https://github.com/ankitpokhrel/jira-cli)

## What you need

First, install and configure the jira CLI:

```bash
# macOS/Linux
brew install jira-cli

# Other platforms: https://github.com/ankitpokhrel/jira-cli#installation

# Set up your credentials
jira init
```

## Install the plugin

```bash
claude plugin marketplace add otahontas/jira-cli-skill
claude plugin install jira
```

## How it works

The plugin doesn't do anything itself - it's pure documentation. It teaches Claude:
- Which jira commands to use for common tasks
- Flags like `--plain` and `--columns` for parseable output
- Patterns that work reliably (no interactive prompts, deterministic results)

So when you ask Claude to "list sprint issues" or "create a bug", it should know how to use jira CLI.

## What's inside

```
skills/jira/SKILL.md              # Main guide - common workflows
skills/jira/scripts/check-environment.sh  # Verifies jira CLI works
skills/jira/references/mcp-parity.md      # Maps Jira MCP â†’ CLI commands
```

The plugin runs the environment check automatically. If jira isn't set up, Claude should mention it to you.
